comments:
Win2K SP3 + IE 6.0.2800.1106 + JRE IBM 1.3 Eclipse help RC 1 & 2
==================================================================
---> Feb. 6 build works OK with embedded activeX. But February 21 RC1 / March 
07 RC2 don't work from IDE or from standalone with ActiveX IE components (clean 
install / clean path no other JRE installed).

Infocenter mode works OK. 

Replaced all help plugins from Feb 06 build--embedded works OK in March 07 RC 
build, so there's some regression in more recent builds.

In Debug mode from full IDE, embedded IE works.

Jamie, 
Few questions:

Does "does not work" mean the window appears and crashes, or no window is 
created at all?

When running with -debug option have you only set
  org.eclipse.help.ui/debug=true
  org.eclipse.help.ui/debug/ieadapter = true
or had you set
  org.eclipse.help.ui/debug/ieadapter/inprocess = true
in .options to get IE to launch.

Is there anything writen in 
eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.help\browser.log file, when 
launching does not work?

Is a file \eclipse\hs_err_pid1248.log (or similar) written?

Thanks.

I talked to Jamie and 
- no .log file was created
- the inprocess was set and that one worked fine (so the activeX could actually 
be embedded). 
- no help browser appeared at all. After launching help, there was an hour 
glass and then it went away, with no other window present.

The remaining question is if file \eclipse\hs_err_pid1248.log (or similar) 
exists.

Output from the browser is collected to 
eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.help\browser.log, which is 
different from eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.log  Could you ensure that the 
first one is not there?
Thanks.

Konrad, Dorian:

browser log for code not working is here; exception is shown. Dorian sent a 
potential fix; I'll try it out and let you know.

Fixed.
It looked like setting the Silent property caused the crash. We are now testing 
if the property exists and then set it.
